cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles SW of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, skirting the southwest Florida coast, then turning northeast to make landfall on the west-central Florida coast before crossing northern Florida and exiting into the western Atlantic late Thursday or early Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Big Bend / Tampa Bay – Yankeetown area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anna Maria Island to Yankeetown on Florida’s west coast; Tropical Storm Watch north of Suwannee River to Aucilla River and portions of western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Dry Tortugas and Bonita Beach to Suwannee River, FL; Storm Surge Watch Bonita Beach to Steinhatchee River including Tampa Bay and Charlotte Harbor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southwest and west-central Florida coast, Big Bend, eventually the northern Florida and southeast Georgia coasts
weather_observation.wind: Isolated tropical-storm-force gusts possible; sustained gales unlikely (≤11% probability of 34-kt winds)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side around Port Everglades (surge forecasts are for Gulf coast)
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–2 inches expected, but saturated soils from earlier 15–20 inch totals mean localized flooding remains likely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous marine conditions and dangerous rip currents along the southeast Florida coast
